div.head: Pounced design for scratching satin
div.ab: After you have pounced with flour or ground chalk, in order that the dots of the pounced design be not erased, follow the trace with glair beaten with the milk or bark of the fig tree, which will immediately make it clear up like water, & without becoming thick, it will keep the trace, which you will follow again & scratch with d a piece of glass or a penknife.

div.head: Canvas for painting in oil without breaking
div.ab: In order that your picture in oil does not break & spoil in the folding of it, make your layer with honey, oil a bit of oil, & water & flour.

div.head: Painting in oil on taffeta which
div.ab: In order that the oil does not run, make your first layer with honey, alum water & starch water.
The main thing is to grind it well on marble, & that it be impalpable & mixed with a little calcined alabaster.

div.head: For outlining a portrait
div.ab: Follow the lines with lake ground with olive oil, which will not dry.

div.head: White varnish on plaster
div.ab: Give two or three coats of quite white glue for painting. Next, varnish with varnish of sandarac, spike lavender oil, and a little mastic. And in the evening put it into a vessel, all pestled well together, without fire, which would turn it yellow. Then with a paintbrush, it is dry immediately. Pour the oil, which will have taken the substance.
